this is another middle of the line kind of game  there are some pretty big flaws with the story and the lack of direction that you receive its often hard to know what you need to do at any point of the game to the point that when i finished it i was surprised because i hadnt any clue that i was around the ending yet  however the combat is good and there is plenty to explore the map is very large and you can spend lots of time exploring each little nook and cranny

i really enjoyed this game and it is one of the better metroidvanias ive played from a gameplay perspective  the story is largely senseless  im not sure if it is a problem with translation or just a bad story but i quickly began skipping dialogue  the art style is beautiful and the platforming is responsive  as other review have stated the game is too big and the quest descriptors oftentimes dont guide you    still i highly recommend it for anyone who enjoys this genre of game

solid metroidvania with an expansive world for exploration  h3likesh3  freedom of exploration with a huge world map  fluid movement and combat  good variety of weapons to use and specialize in  great visual style and music  h3dislikesh3  hard to follow plot with key information kept in ng  no particularly challenging enemies or platforming sections  unclear solution to remove fog mechanics in certain areas  fast travel requires a consumable

definitely worth a play even if you can feel pretty lost sometimes when you didnt check the one magic dialog option that unlocks your path forward  quest text being very vague didnt help either so one hint for happiness check every dialog option or you will find out you did miss a lvl 45 area when you already lvl 60 like me  but all in all a nice game one of the very few games i made it to 100 achievements mostly because they felt acutally achieveable
one of the best metroidvania style games i have played
